III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A resides in a Foster Care Placement at DA Blodgett St.
John's Home. Staff 1 is a staff member at the facility.
On 12/7/2024 around 11am, Staff 1 bought vapes for Youth A and
provided them to Youth A in the hallways of the residential home.
Investigation Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/10/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker She reported
being informed of the allegations from Supervisor 1. She also
reported a belief that Staff 1 informed Youth A that Youth A could
not attend an outing and Youth A responded with saying Youth A
would report Staff 1 for buying Youth A vapes. Administrator
believes Youth A yelled this down the hall and this may be on
video; however, she was unable to locate any such video. She
also reported Staff 2 reported the allegations to Supervisor 1.
Administrator was interviewed again face-to-face at the
facility on 12/17/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
She reported staff did find 4 vape pens in Youth B’s room but
nothing in Youth A’s room. She also reported visits between Youth
A and Youth A’s mother are supervised by Case Manager Foster
Care and the concerns of Youth A’s mother (Parent) providing
vapes is being investigated by the foster care team. Administrator
was informed of Youth A’s mother providing vapes by MDHHS
worker when Youth A shared text messages with Youth B who
informed the MDHHS worker during an interview.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/10/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
being aware of the allegations but reported a good relationship
with Youth A. She also denied the allegations and doesn’t know
why Youth A would report something like the allegations. Staff 1
2

was unable to recall not allowing Youth A something and having
Youth A get upset. She reported being informed by Supervisor 2
that Youth A may have a vape but a vape was never found on
Youth A in person. She also reported asking to look in Youth A’s
purse, but Youth A refused until Youth A spent time with the nurse
away from Staff 1. After visiting with the nurse, Youth A allowed
Staff 1 to examine the purse.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/10/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A
reported not having knowledge of the reasons or allegations.
Youth A also denied Staff 1, nor any other staff offered to buy
Youth A, a vape. Youth A reported having staff to talk with when
upset and believes the staff are good at the program. Youth A also
reported all the staff make Youth A feel safe at the facility. Youth A
denied having a vape and stopped vaping prior to going into foster
care.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via phone on 12/10/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported being on-call
the weekend of the allegations and receiving a call from Staff 1
about taking Youth A shopping. When calling back, Supervisor 1
spoke with Staff 2 and Staff 2 informed Supervisor 1 that Youth A
was upset and yelling at Youth A’s favorite staff (unknow who this
staff is), was giving Youth A vapes and buying vapes. Supervisor
1 reported sending a message to Staff 2 about what staff and Staff
2 responded it was Staff 1 Youth A was identifying. Supervisor 1
reported after gathering this information, a report to DHHS was
made. Supervisor 1 also reported being the direct supervisor of
Staff 1 and Staff 1 has had only one disciplinary action for
attendance. Supervisor 1 reported no youth have complained
about Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 has no concerns about Staff 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 12/16/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported sitting at a
table with Staff 1 and Youth A when Youth A became angry at
Staff 1. She also reported Youth A stated “don’t make me (Youth
A) tell them what you (Staff 1) do for me (Youth A)” to Staff 1. Staff
2 reported Youth A also said “I (Youth A) will tell them my favorite
staff (Staff 1) bought me (Youth A) a vape”. Staff 2 also reported
believing Youth A was upset with Staff 1 after Staff 1 asked
permission to take Youth A to Walmart and when it took a long
time to obtain permission to do so, Youth A became upset. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 just “froze” and had no response when Staff 2
asked if this statement from Youth A was true. Staff 2 also
reported telling Staff 1, that this is the reason Staff 2 avoids taking
3

youth to the store. Staff 2 also reported having no concerns about
Staff 1 except for smelling cigarette smoke when Staff 1 brought
the vehicle back and Staff 2 had to use the vehicle. Staff 2
reported informing Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 3 of the cigarette
smoke smell last when it occurred. Staff 2 also reported Staff 1
and Youth A have a good relationship. Staff 2 reported believing
Youth A has a vape, but staff have not been able to find this vape
even after a room search. Staff 2 reported at this time, Staff 1 is
not allowed to transport youth.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/17/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported
not having any knowledge of the allegations but did hear of
rumors of Youth A having a vape. He also reported staff have
found no evidence of a vape.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth Development specialist Procedures dated
2/2022. This document outlines the role and responsibilities
of a Youth Development Specialist (Staff 1’s role) at the
facility. It is documented that the Youth Development
Specialist (YDS) is to maintain clear and appropriate
boundaries, including personal boundaries. Staff are to
separate their personal life from work life and not share
information or have a youth visit with the staff’s
family/friends. Staff are also to maintain boundaries and
confidentiality of youth even when off duty. Staff are to
engage in positive activities that are both therapeutic and
helpful to the youth having a successful outcome in the
program.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Documentation indicates Staff 1
was hired on 2/1/2024 and there is one disciplinary action
documented in the file. Staff 1 received a formal verbal
corrective action and improvement plan on 10/30/24 after
accumulating a point total when calling in on 10/13, 10/20,
and 10/17 resulting in a point accumulation of 6.5. Staff 1
was found to be in violation of the attendance policy and if
further attendance points are accumulated a final warning
will be issues at 8 points. Corrective action involves Staff 1
is to review the attendance policy during her monthly
supervision and monitoring by her direct supervisor.
documents in the file. Documentation supports Staff 1 is
current on her training, having completed 130.47 hours
since hire.
4

Analysis The agency is found in compliance as evidence by interviews with
staff and written documentation. Both Staff 1 and Youth A deny
the allegations and there were no other witnesses to the
allegations.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered in regard to ensuring staff are
fully aware of the policy always setting an appropriate example
when in the presence of the youth in their care. It is also
recommended that this topic be a constant during staff meetings.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
